column1: #Text=[0051] N.sub.m=number of measured data points, and
#Text=[0053] Referring to FIG. 5, thus, using the above-described pressure-pressure convolution, a process 100 may be used to estimate a particular parameter that characterizes the formation 54.
#Text=In this process 100, the pressure changes (due to the start of the flow 62) at the sink and observation points are determined (block 102).
#Text=Subsequently, using these pressure changes, the deconvolved G function is determined (block 104), as described above.
#Text=Next, the process 100 includes identifying (block 106) a possible model to be used in the estimation of reservoir parameters from the G function.
#Text=This model identification may be carried out, for example, by searching for a similar signature of the deconvolved G function from a library of available model responses.
#Text=The geological as well as openhole and/or casedhole log information for the formation may be incorporated with the flow regime analysis for the model identification.

#Text=[0054] Next in the process 100, using the model obtained from block 106, the unknown reservoir parameters are estimated (block 108) using an estimation algorithm, such as, for example, a nonlinear inversion or least squares algorithm, such as the least squares algorithm that is depicted in Eq. 7.
#Text=This estimation algorithm may involve an iterative process during which some of the model parameters may be dropped from the unknown parameters if the measurements are not sensitive to them.
#Text=Consequently, these parameters are fixed, or constant during the estimation.
#Text=[0055] After the unknown parameter(s) are estimated, a comparison (block 110) is made between the measured and the calculated pressure changes at the observation point.
#Text=This comparison may be done, for example, graphically.
#Text=If a determination (diamond 112) is made that the comparison is satisfactory, then the estimation and interpretation are complete.
#Text=Otherwise, the process 100 returns to block 106 to identify another model to estimate the unknown parameter(s).
